isis.stitle: TSI 91-08-05 - Correction For Tripping Of Heater/Air Conditioner Breakers

subjectgroup.subject: Correction For Tripping Of Heater/Air Conditioner Breakers

geninfo.para: Loose connections between the wire terminals and circuit breakers S20 and/or S21 can cause heat, which trips the circuit breakers, shutting off either one or both heater/air conditioner blower motors. If both blower motors shut off, there will be little heat and no air conditioning. The circuit breakers will not reset until the heater/air conditioner switch is placed in the off position, allowing the circuit breakers to cool. For vehicles that exhibit this condition, an in-line circuit breaker connector with pigtails and improved wire to the circuit breaker terminals is available (see Figure 1 and Figure 2).

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: For vehicles on which the heater/air conditioner circuit breaker trips, in-line circuit breaker connectors with pigtails ( Figure 1) can be installed as follows:

step1.para: Remove switch control module from instrument panel.
Remove and discard the black and white circuit wires that are connected between ignition feed stud J2 and circuit breakers S20 and S21 on the switch control module.
Remove circuit breakers S20 and S21 from the switch control module and disconnect from harness (circuits 75A & B and 75J & K).

Slide a short piece of 1/4-inch diameter heat sink tubing (if available) over one pigtail of each in-line circuit breaker connector, strip the appropriate amount of insulation, and solder a ring terminal ( Figure 2) to the end of that wire.
Shrink the tubing on the neck of the ring terminal or insulate with electrical tape.
Bend the ring terminal to an angle of approximately 45 degrees ( Figure 2).
Securely attach both ring terminals to ignition feed stud J2.

Strip approximately 1 inch of insulation from the other pigtail of one of the in-line circuit breaker connectors. Cut off the existing terminals and strip approximately 1 inch of insulation from circuit wires 75A & B.
Twist the pigtail and circuit wires 75A & B together and solder this connection.
Shrink 3/8-inch heat shrink tubing on this splice or insulate with electrical tape.
Repeat Steps 9, 10, and 11 for the other in-line circuit breaker connector and circuit wires 75J & K.
Insert new 30-amp circuit breakers in each in-line circuit breaker connector.
Fold the in-line circuit breaker connector back against the harness and tie in place with plastic tie straps. Do not strap or tape over the circuit breaker or connector.
